alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 17 at 11:54PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Indiana, including the following county, Jefferson IN. Portions of NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following county, Trimble. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1154 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Madison, Hanover, Smyrna, Milton, Dupont, Brooksburg, North Madison, Ringwald, Wirt and Madison Municipal Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
